meanings.definition: To have a particular liking or desire for
meanings.sent1: She fancied the red dress in the store window.
meanings.sent2: He fancied ice cream on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The cat fancied the cozy spot by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The child fancied the idea of flying like a superhero.
meanings.sent5: The student fancied the thought of acing the test.

meanings.definition: To imagine or believe something to be true
meanings.sent1: He fancied he saw a ghost in the old house.
meanings.sent2: She fancied that it would rain later in the day.
meanings.sent3: The detective fancied himself as a famous sleuth.
meanings.sent4: The artist fancied the canvas as a blank slate for creativity.
meanings.sent5: The child fancied monsters under the bed at night.

meanings.definition: To have a romantic interest in someone
meanings.sent1: He fancied the new girl in his class.
meanings.sent2: She fancied the idea of a candlelit dinner.
meanings.sent3: The prince fancied the princess from a neighboring kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The teenager fancied himself in a romantic movie scene.
meanings.sent5: The couple fancied a stroll under the starry sky.
